message:
Fix d3.geo.circle.origin.

3D rotations are not commutative, so we must perform an inverse rotation
to move something from origin [0, 0] to [λ, φ].  Normally we are moving
origin [λ, φ] to [0, 0].
GeometryCollection is a *geometry*, not objecttype (c.f. http://www.geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#geometry-objects). this makes nested test pass.
d3.geo.centroid: fix handling of mixed geometries.

Fix treemap slice-dice mode.

For even depths, it was falling back to Math.min(rect.dx, rect.dy)
instead of always "dicing" (rect.dy).
Fix benchmark by restoring test data file.
Fix broken tests due to missing sample data.

Remove axis examples.

Replaced by <http://bl.ocks.org/4349486>, among others.

Remove force-cluster example.

Would be nice to update, but perhaps another time.

Remove chord examples.

Replaced by <http://bl.ocks.org/4062006>.
Replaced by <http://bl.ocks.org/1046712>.
Move sample HTML file to test/data.

Remove hierarchical bar example.

Replaced with <http://bl.ocks.org/1283663>.

Remove splom example.

Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/4063663>.
Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/3213173>.

Remove choropleth examples.

Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/4060606>.
Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/4206573>.
Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/4206857>.

Remove cartogram examples.

Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/843177>.
Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/4055892>.
Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/4055889>.

Remove hive examples.

Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/2066421>.
Moved to <http://bl.ocks.org/2066415>.
Remove deprecated support for wrapping data.

Revert "Remove backwards-compatibility for d3.xhr."

This reverts commit c3635192d87c3c8ad573224283185c1b01c6b69b.

Coerce to number for d3.quantile.

This avoids string concatentation on fractional p-values.
Restore tighter threshold for CCW polygons.

Fix CCW polygon detection issue.

The south pole rotation could result in line segments that go through
the poles.  These are characterised by a 180° longitudinal difference.
These cases were not handled properly by the approximation algorithm,
but it now handles both north and south pole cases.
Increase threshold for ccw polygon detection.

Optimise d3.geo.clip area calculation.

Only the area sign is needed to determine the polygon winding order, so
a fast approximation is sufficient.

U.S. counties benchmark: 84ms/op → 51ms/op.
Fix a bug with d3_geo_resample lineStart.
Move rotation modulus to radian conversion code.

Rename for clarity.

d3_geo_cut is now d3_geo_clipAntimeridian.
d3_geo_circleClip is now d3_geo_clipCircle.
Fallback for projections that don't stream.

Adjust threshold for distortion resampling.

Includes test case.
Resample between first and last ring points.
Add test for pointRadius function type coercion.

Remove extraneous type coercion.

Not needed since we already do it in the public API.

Minor d3.geo.centroid tweak.

The previous version always reassigned .lineEnd in .lineStart anyway,
but this is slightly more efficient to only do so in .ringEnd.

Update UglifyJS.

The package name has now changed back to "uglify-js" on NPM.

Fixes for d3.geo[.path].centroid.

Mixed geometries should now be supported correctly for both.
Update centroid tests to use undefined.

d3.geo.centroid: {Feature,Geometry}Collection.

This computes the centroid of the geometries with the highest dimension.

Better handling of ambiguous centroids.

Rather than doing something like picking the last seen point, return
an undefined centroid if it is ambiguous.

Users can decide what to do, e.g. when picking an origin for a rotating
globe, using the last coordinate in a MultiPoint or LineString seems
reasonable in an ambiguous situation.

Benchmark U.S. counties.

This is useful to see how fast we can process polygons that don't
intersect with the clip edge.
Polygon area is consistent with holes.

Fix Polygon clipping issue.

The missing endpoint was causing issues with the algorithm.
Fixes for streaming area and centroid.

Don't emit closing points in rings.

This breaks d3.geo.path area & centroid, and d3.geo.area. Fix incoming.
Fix a bug in d3.geo.path area.
Fix lineStart reset bug in d3.geo.area.

Don't cache d3_geo_bounds for projection.

I mean, we could, but it seems simpler not to, for now.

Delete d3.geo.rotation.

That was for demonstration purposes only.

Refactor clipping to use streams.

Work in progress: everything is treated as lines at the moment.

Add d3.geo.stream.

This will replace d3_geo_type and make projection faster.

More robust handling of polygons with empty ring(s).

This is a valid situation but won't usually happen at the moment since
we don't return empty rings when clipping.

Optimise resampling using Cartesian coordinates.

Should we decide to cache Cartesian coordinates, this would benefit
from this somewhat.
Rename a few things for clarity.

Resample in-place.

Also add some TODOs about places where we can reduce the number of objects we
create during projection. (I expect more opportunities for optimization.)

Simplify.

This includes a minor tweak to d3_geo_type to avoid errors if the object
is null e.g. due to being removed by clipping.

Improve performance.

Calling Object.create frequently is slow, and isn't needed when
generating SVG paths anyway.
Refactor d3.geo.projection to be more data-driven.
Don't expose the entire map, just a function.
Air out the code for readability.

Fix d3_geo_type; expose d3.geo.rotation.

Not sure we want to expose d3.geo.rotation, since it's functionality that's also
provided by d3.geo.projection.
Allow d3_geo_type to transform & filter GeoJSON.
Extract simple vector math from d3_geo_circle.
d3.geo.area: improve handling of tiny polygons.

Add d3.geo.centroid.

Polygons are temporarily treated as lines while I work on adding area
weighting.

See #941.

Merge pull request #949 from jasondavies/°

s/º/°/g

Set node velocity to zero when fixed.

This should avoid unintended jitter on mouseover.
Fix loss of significance for d3.geom.polygon.area.
Respect clipping for line and point centroids.
Take into account clipping when computing centroids.

Take into account clipping when computing areas.

This can be optimised later.

Define a new "Sphere" GeoJSON type.

This allows us to generate the clip outline for whole-earth projections
with arbitrary rotations.

Internally, this is interpreted as a polygon with null coordinates.

Revert "Restore support for empty & ccw polygons."

This reverts commit 7712dcd59ed6ed0ef153c1f8e6ce5065e5d784b7.

Unfortunately, this caused empty polygons to be interpreted as "the
whole sphere", which is undesirable.  Also, it is more useful to have a
definite graticule outline, at least for a graticule that doesn't cover
the whole sphere.
Restore support for empty & ccw polygons.

Add some test cases for small U.S. counties.

These were originally anticlockwise in examples/data/us-counties.  I
have corrected the ordering for these tests.

Detect polygon direction using area calculation.

This fixes various problems that were occurring due to winding numbers
being tricky on a finite sphere.

This also includes some cleanup and fixes for degenerate points.

Fix antemeridian reverse interpolation.

This is in preparation for a self-intersecting polygon fix.

Fix path.centroid for polygons with holes.

The centroid was not being subtracted for interior polygon rings
(holes), hence it was appearing too far to the right.  The winding order
is ignored.
